abstract: Review of drug-possession trials reveals undercover police officers in New York City have been arresting drug addicts by posing as fellow addicts and giving them money to purchase drugs; tactic has drawn criticism from defense lawyers and juries who question aggressive pursuit of troubled addicts rather than dealers.
lead_paragraph: Defense lawyers and jurors have vigorously questioned a strategy by the New York Police Department that prizes the pursuit of the addicts who use drugs over the people who supply them.

headline.main: Undercover Officers Ask Addicts to Buy Drugs, Snaring Them but Not Dealers
headline.print_headline: Officers Snaring Drug Addicts, Not Dealers
